titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the South Africa Historical Collection
titlestmt.author: compiled by Carol King and staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 10:51

did.unittitle: South Africa historical collection

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The collection consists of correspondence; journals and diaries; government documents; reports and printed material of various organizations, political parties, and individuals; ephemera; and photographs which document various aspects of the history of South Africa and its political, economic, social, and cultural conditions from the colonial period of the 1800s to 1948, the year which marks the legalization of apartheid. The bulk of the collection focuses on the South African War, more commonly known as the Boer War (1899-1902).

langmaterial.language: The material is in English, Afrikaans, Dutch, and French.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the African Collection Curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: South Africa Historical Collection (MS 1556). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

relatedmaterial.head: Associated Materials
relatedmaterial.p: African Collection, MS 605; Pamphlet Collection, MS 1351; African Postcard Collection, MS 1575. Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The original accession is arranged chronologically in two categories: manuscript/printed materials and photographs. Additions to collection may vary in arrangement.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of correspondence; journals and diaries; government documents; reports and printed material of various organizations, political parties, and individuals; ephemera; and photographs which document various aspects of the history of South Africa and its political, economic, social, and cultural conditions from the colonial period of the 1800s to 1948, the year which marks the legalization of apartheid. The bulk of the collection focuses on the South African War, more commonly known as the Boer War (1899-1902).

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

did.unittitle: Inventory

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This listing is arranged in chronological order.

did.unittitle: Manuscripts/printed matter
Cape Colony legal documents [papers concerning the Justice Department, the Notary, and real estate]
Letter from British sea captain to Monsieur le Compte d'Escotais of Cape Town [concerning the return of French vessel Sylphe to French authorities]
Order of the Privy Council of George IV [approving a rate of exchange in British silver money per paper dollar in the payment of British troops serving in the Cape of Good Hope and Ceylon]
Bower, John [correspondence and documents concerning Cape farms]
"The Journal of William Clayton Humphreys; Being a Personal Narrative of the Adventures and Experiences of a Trader and Hunter in the Zulu Country During the Months of July-October, 1851" [reprinted]
Russell, Anne Emily A. [manuscript diary describing life in Cape Town]
"The Schreiner House, Cradock" [brochure for home/gallery devoted primarily to Olive Schreiner, South Africa's first noted English prose writer (1855-1920)] [published]
"The Cape Town-Simon's Town Railway (1860)" [brochure published by the Cape Town Heritage Trust]
"125th Anniversary of the Arrival of Indentured Indian Labour to Natal, 1860-1985" [published]
Journal/diary of an English? trader [transcriptions included]
Kower, J. P., Jr. [travel journals entitled "From Cleveland to South Africa," "Last Stop at the Diamond Field," "Trip to England," and "Safe in London"]
Hawes, Alfred [illustrated pocket diary describing trans-Atlantic voyage from Massachusetts to South Africa to acquire native birds and animals]
Orders in Council of Queen Victoria [regarding annexation of territories and revocation of letters of patent]
Orders in Council of Queen Victoria and Edward VII [Natal; regarding fugitive colonies, responsible government, native locations]

Orders in Council of Queen Victoria and Edward VII with the advice of the Privy Council [Basutoland, Bechuanaland, Griqualand West, and Swaziland; regarding annexation, fugitive criminals, administration of justice, appointment of resident commissioners, Crown lands, etc.]
Hendrie, James H. [letters from South African diamond fields, transcribed by Margaret R. Meyer]
Fraser, Thomas [copy letters dating from during and after the First Boer War; eyewitness account of the Battle of Majuba Hill]
"The Salvation Army, South Africa Territory, A Century of Service [1883-1983]" [commemorative centenary booklet]
Cape Infantry regiment [recruitment poster]
Mansel-Dakyns, Lort, A Year on Bully Beef and Biscuits or Methuen's Horse in Becuanaland [typescript by a sergeant in C Troop of Methuen's First Mounted Rifles]

"The Chartered Companies" A Year on Bully Beef and Biscuits or Methuen's Horse in Becuanaland [typescript regarding the Niger Company (1886-1899), the Imperial British East Africa Company (1887-1895); and the British South Africa Company (1889-1923; footnotes]
"James Stuart's Notes and Queries on John Bird's Annals of Natal," edited by Grant Christison [1888]
Letter from the postmaster to F. Hanbury Stacy, member of Parliament, concerning the mailing of postcards to countries outside of the Union
Sigcau, Paramount Chief of the Pondo Nation [interview by P. H. Faure, Secretary of Native Affairs]
Ross, David [manuscript diary of a surgeon on the S.S. Ilovo ; London to Durham, includes sketches and newspaper clippings]
Land grant certificate of the Zuid-Afrikaansche Republiek (Z. A. R.) [bearing signature of President S. J. P. Kruger]
Calitzdorp Irrigation Scheme [document of coal specifications and contracts]
Reitz, Francis W., State Secretary of the Transvaal and former President of the Orange Free State [notification of the appointment of R. F. Aling as magistrate to Klerksdorp]
Boer War [letters from soldiers]
Frampton, Fred J. [soldier's diary describing journey from England to Bloemfontein; includes impressions of the Boers]
"John Bull in Zuid Afrika" [Dutch anti-British illustrated pamphlet regarding Boer War]
Ruda, Richard M., "The Irish Nationalist Reaction to the South African War, 1899-1902"
"Ladysmith and Lydenburg: Anglo-Boer War Letters of Alfred Markham" [1899-1902]
The City of London Imperial Volunteers (C. I. V.) [illustrated souvenir book]
Litchford, R. [notebook written while in prisoner of war camp on St. Helena]
The Morning Leader [leaflets: #5 "The Real Motive for the War" and #7 "The Hawksley Diary"]
Victor, Christian [bills of sale and photographs with biographical information]
"The Siege Valentine" [illustrated card concerning the Siege of Ladysmith]
National Bazaar in Aid of the Sufferers by the War [souvenir and official program]
Kitchener, Commander in Chief [notice to Burgers in Pretoria recommending their voluntary surrender]
Ogden's Limited Cigarette Cards "Tab" Series [60 different cards depicting military or political personalities from the Boer War; includes Baden Powell, Churchill, Rhodes, Cronje, and Joubert]
"The Red Cross in the Boer War" [four different chromo lithographed, die-cut scraps]
Carruthers, Jane, "Attitudes to Game Conservation in the Transvaal, 1900-1910" [thesis]
Tobacco and cigarette collectible cards ["African Types" and "Transvaal Series"]
Sullivan, Harry I., [letter describing a campaign in the Orange Free State during the Boer War]
Crofton, Henry William George [letters and photographs relating to his death in the Boer War]
Copies of documents regarding peace negotiations between Lord Kitchener and Generals Botha De Wet and De La Rey
The Bloemfontein Post [declaration of peace flyer]
Boer/Afrikaner women and children in South African War [two articles on their plight and treatment]
"Report on the Organization and Working of the South African Permit Office" [prepared by the Intelligence Division, War Office]
Transvaal Consolidated Land and Exploration Co., Limited [report on agriculture]
Orange River Colony [agreement regarding purchase of lands]
Chinese labour in the Transvaal [booklets]
Buller, Redvers, Commander in Chief in South Africa who raised the siege of Ladysmith [letters to Captain E. W. Parker regarding publication of their private correspondence]
Johnston, Colonel D. A. [documents from his estate concerning the government in post-war Transvaal]

Central South African Railways [agreement between the Inter-Colonial Council of the Transvaal and Orange River Colony, the Klerksdorp-Fourteen Steams Railway Company, and the De Beers Consolidated Mines Limited for acquisition of the Klerksdorp-Fourteen Streams Railway]
"Letters from South Africa" [journal from unidentified father to son, includes photographs of journey from England; railroads, mines, and landscape]
National Party [South African election results]
"A Christian Colour-Sergeant: Brief Memoir of Col-Sergt. Macmillan" [biography and letters, 3rd ed.]
"The Syndicalist Conspiracy in South Africa" [speech on deportations by General J. C. Smuts, Minister of Defence]
Letter from the captain of H. M. S. "Albion" in Walfisch Bay, S. W. Africa [reporting his ship's movements between Oct 31 and Nov 15, 1914]
Kirby, W. H., Hunting the Hun in (British) South West Africa [series of sketches on the humorous side of the German South West African Campaign]
Letter from Miss Emily, a school teacher of Marilzbury to her cousin Romola in England [personal letter touching briefly on civil uprising]
The native riots at Port Elizabeth of October 23, 1920 [official report and letter]
Glass, C. F. [member of the South African section of the Communist International, letters to the editor]
Port Elizabeth [travel brochure]
Class Areas Bill [statements by the Indian Deputation and the Natal Indian Association]
Smuts, Jan Christiaan, "Memorandum on Government Natives and Coloured Bills"
Union Education Department [notes on conference and documents regarding native education]
Maclachlan, A. N. L., "South African Railways: A Short Description of, and Notes on, the System and its Locomotives, Train Services and Characteristics"
Department of Agriculture and Forestry, Veterinary Division [paper on foot and mouth diseases]
British Commonwealth of Nations [souvenir program of exhibition]
Lindberg, Scott, Native Housing
Industrial Conciliation Act [regarding the clothing industry in the Transvaal]
"Report of the Departmental Committee of Enquiry into the Collection of Native Tax"
Transvaal Chamber of Mines, "Memorandum on the Mortality Amongst Tropical Natives Employed on the Witwatersrand Gold Mines"
Hoernle, A. W., "An Appeal to the People of South Africa" [letter objecting to the South African Senate Bill which would deprive blacks of the vote]
South Africa Institute of Race Relations [reports and statements on labor issues, native affairs, and the Indian people]
Johannesburg District Communist Party

United Party [speeches, souvenir books, photographs, including "Letters of a Farmer"; election materials and statements of policy including "What is Nationalist Party Policy for 18 Year Olds and Under?"; program from Congresses]
The German-African Party (Anti-Nazi) (G. A. P.), Fanfare [periodical]
Honikman, A. H., "Racial Amity in City's [Cape Town's] Franchise History," from Coloured Municipal Vote Record
Ossewabrandwag [loosely translated as ox wagon sentinels, an organization founded in 1938 to preserve culture of South Africa]
Johannesburg riots of January 31 and February 1, 1941 [the official report given by Sir Patrick Duncan, Governor General]
Coghlan, Mark, "Schrapnel, Sand and Stukas: The Carbineers in the Western Desert, 1941-1942"
The Union of South Africa (Nationalist Party) [statements on foreign and native policy, paper on progress achieved, constitution]
Clutterbuck, N. S. [South African Air Force flight logbook; correspondence and photographs laid in]
"Clothing Requirements Survey," Industrial Development Corporation of South Africa, Ltd.
Non-European Unity Movement (N. E. U. M) [papers, declarations, and addresses concerning trade unions and congresses]
"Prisoners of War Newspapers" [reproductions from "The Benghazi Forum" and "The Tuturano Times"]
"Cape Town Citizens" [booklet of proceedings of group's 49th meetings, includes Cape Town mayor's broadcast on invasion of Europe by Allied troops]
Army Educational Services, "What the Soldier Thinks" [unpublished, confidential study by the Union Defense Forces]
National Union of South African Students (N. U. S. A. S) [magazine, booklet, letter on academic freedom and university segregation]
"The Royal Visit" [official souvenir program for visit of King George VI and Queen Elizabeth to Durban and Port Elizabeth]
United Nations General Assembly [evaluation of attempts to implement the December 18, 1946 resolution to end discrimination against Indians in South Africa]
Setalvad, M. C., leader of Indian Delegation to the United Nations General Assembly [speech on the treatment of Indians in South Africa]
Die Nuus [newspaper]
The Civil Rights League [printed material on citizenship, democracy, apartheid and purpose of organization]
Siegfried, Andre, "Les Problèmes Ethniques de L'Afrique du Sud," [conference; Supplèment au Bulletin de l'Association des Anciens Etudiants de l'UniversitèColoniale de Belgique]
Government Gazette [newspaper of the Union of South Africa]
Transvaal Indian Organization (T. I. O.) [letters, bulletins, congress notes]
Hector, A. R. and Calderwood, D. M., "A New Native Town for Witbank Municipality," National Building Research Institute, South African Council for Scientific and Industrial Research
The Africa Bureau [pamphlets on labor, native resources, culture, and apartheid]
Van Riebeeck Festival [tercentennial commemoration of Jan van Riebeeck's landing at the Cape]
Cilliers, A. C., " Ex Unitate Vires ; A Plea for a Grand Political Alliance as a Prerequisite for the Solution of the South African Trilemma"
Die Middellander [newspaper]
"High Court of Parliament Reverses Appeal Judgment on Voter's Act" [South Africa news cable]
South African Institute of International Affairs [papers, letters, and addresses on politics, economy, and defense]
Transvaal Indian Youth Congress (T. I. Y. C.) [bulletins and newsletters; programs, speeches, and printed materials from annual conferences]
The Liberal Party [letters and statements of policy]
Brookes, Edgar, The Constitution and Public Confidence [published by Defenders of the Constitution]
Du Plessis, W. C., chairman of the South African delegation [statement on apartheid to the Ad Hoc Political Committee]
Hepple, Alex, A Trade Union Guide for South African Workers [published by South African Congress of Trade Unions (SACTU)]
"Administration of the Group Appeals Act" [report by unidentified author]
"Boycott of Nationalist Controlled Products" [pamphlet]
Opinion [Indian newspaper]
"The Multi-Racial Conference," [University of the Witwatersrand]
"The Tightrope Dancers" [report of the 7th Annual Conference, Institute of Administrator of Non-European Affairs]
Socialist League of Africa (newsletters and editorials]
Society of Young Africa [bulletin]
"The Bahufutshe of Manyane" [brief history]
University College of Fort Hare [student magazine and graduation booklet]
South African Conciliation Committee [newsletter, membership card]
Whither South Africa?: An analysis of Fascism, Nazism and Greyshirtism and their influence on the politics of the Union [published by South African Liberty Press]
South Africa Rugby Cards ["Play Up De Beers," "Watch Your Men Kimberley," and "Well Done Natal"]

Photographs from the H. M. Transport "St. Andrew" during the Boer War and China Expedition [South Africa, St. Helena; presumably belonging to A. Weston Jarvis]

"Pictorial Views of St. Helena and Illustrations of the Military Camps and Boer Prisoners of War"

South Africa and Zimbabwe [a few of Zanzibar, Mozambique; 2 volumes]
Cape Colony, South Africa [family's travel album, town and country scenes, soldiers, Kaffirs; mainly photos of New Zealand]

Towns, native huts, landscapes and game, some Eastern Africa?
Tourist photos and souvenir cards from the voyage of the "Toledo" [mainly West Africa and Nigeria]

Private collection of photographs of Cape Town and Swanage, U. K.

Historical photographs of South Africa, Rhodesia; also photographs of Cecil Rhodes and Emperor Wilhelm [letter laid in]
Mining properties in Rhodesia, military scenes at onset of Boer War
Boer War [includes Rustenberg, Shashi River, Groote Schuur, the Rhodes's farm, important military locations; presumably belonging to Jarvis]
Boer War [Elandsfontein, Standerton, Heidelberg]
Boer War [including the capture of General Erasows?, battle-fields, concentrations camps, peace conference]

South African scenery [two loose photos laid in including one depicting the shooting of Matabele spies]

British military photographs [Cape Town, Bloemfontein, Pretoria, etc.]
World War I [scrapbook compiled by William Jardine, a British officer in German Southwest Africa; photographs, clippings, and several posters]
Album of a visit to South Africa and return voyage [photographs taken on board the S. S. "Nestor" and the S. S. "Ascanius," also photographs of various locations in South Africa]
Souvenir album from a three-month vacation in South Africa [Cape Town, Devil's Peak, Table Mountain, Rhodes Memorial, Groote Schuur]
Queenstown, South Africa [mostly family portraits and greeting cards, some of Queenstown, Scotland and England]
Reynolds, Alexander, photographs of natives and wildlife from southern and central Africa [2 volumes]

Bound volume of letters to his wife pertaining to his role as major general in the Boer War [includes photograph of Hutton and plans of operations; rear pocket contains "Briton or Boer: New Map of South Africa"

Coke, Roger [aide-de-camp to Prince Arthur, Duke of Connaught]
Correspondence to/from the Department of Defence, pertaining to military equipment, such as mine sweeping vessels and aircraft
Harvey, Gilbert R. [assistant surgeon at the Second Cavalry B ______ Field Hospital]
Diary in two volumes describing military skirmishes, camp conditions, and related topics

Durban Civic Centenary Celebration
Souvenir programs pertaining to theatrical productions; receptions and balls; art exhibits; concerts; agricultural and industrial fairs; air shows; and related events celebrating Durban's centenary

Photograph album [containing photographs of Victoria Falls and other points of scenic interest; natives; villages; cities; mining sites; and unidentified individuals]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

Union of South Africa [memoranda pertaining to the socio-economic development/self government of the Bantu areas]

Old House Museum [guide to the historical collections]

Poster announcing a talk on the Boer War ["All Yale Men are Cordially Invited to Be Present"] [New Haven?]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Files in this accession are listed alphabetically by type of material.

Labour Party [election campaign flier]
Legal Education Action Project (LEAP) [educational materials]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The accession contains guide books, pamphlets, and an itinerary for travel in South Africa, including rail and cruise information. Many of the books are produced by the Thos. Cook & Son travel service.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence of Charles O. Nash, an Englishman, written to his sister Edie, and documenting his experiences working and traveling in South Africa during the gold rush of the late 19th century. The title of each letter in the inventory is indicative of the location from which it was written.
